title: Fuel Your Performance
description: Proper nutrition is essential for peak performance on and off the field.
content:
Fuel Your Performance

Proper nutrition is essential for peak performance on and off the field.

Pre-Game Meals

Eat 2-3 hours before game time. Focus on:

  • Complex carbohydrates (pasta, rice, whole grains)
  • Lean protein (chicken, fish, beans)
  • Limit fats and fiber to avoid digestive issues

Hydration

Stay hydrated throughout the day:

  • Drink water consistently, not just when you're thirsty
  • Aim for 8-10 glasses per day
  • During practice/games: 4-8 oz every 15-20 minutes
  • Avoid sugary drinks and excessive caffeine

Post-Game Recovery

Within 30 minutes after activity, consume:

  • Protein for muscle repair (20-30g)
  • Carbohydrates to replenish glycogen stores
  • Electrolytes to replace what you've lost through sweat

title: Meal Planning for Athletes
description: Learn how to plan balanced meals that support your training and recovery.
content:
Meal Planning for Athletes

Planning your meals ahead of time ensures you're getting the right nutrients when you need them most.

Breakfast

Start your day with a balanced breakfast:

  • Whole grain cereal or oatmeal
  • Fresh fruit
  • Protein source (eggs, Greek yogurt, or protein shake)

Lunch

Midday meals should be substantial but not heavy:

  • Lean protein (chicken, turkey, fish)
  • Complex carbs (brown rice, quinoa, sweet potato)
  • Vegetables for vitamins and minerals

Dinner

Evening meals support recovery:

  • High-quality protein for muscle repair
  • Colorful vegetables for antioxidants
  • Healthy fats (avocado, nuts, olive oil)
